io.spine.server.model

Class MessageHandlerMap<M extends io.spine.type.MessageClass<?>,H extends HandlerMethod<?,M,?,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.model.MessageHandlerMap<M,H>
  • Type Parameters:
    M - the type of messages
    H - the type of handler methods
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    @Immutable(containerOf={"M","H"})
public final class MessageHandlerMap<M extends io.spine.type.MessageClass<?>,H extends HandlerMethod<?,M,?,?>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Provides mapping from a class of messages to methods which handle such messages.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static <M extends io.spine.type.MessageClass<?>,H extends HandlerMethod<?,M,?,?>> MessageHandlerMap<M,H> create(java.lang.Class<?> declaringClass,
                                                                                                                       MethodSignature<H,?> signature)
        Creates a map of methods found in the passed class.
        Parameters:
        declaringClass - the class to inspect
        signature - the signature of methods
        Returns:
        new MessageHandlerMap of methods of the given class matching the given signature

      • getMessageClasses

        public java.util.Set<M> getMessageClasses()
        Obtains classes of messages for which handlers are stored in this map.

      • containsClass

        public boolean containsClass(M messageClass)
        Returns true if the handler map contains a method that handles the passed class of messages, false otherwise.

      • getMessageClasses

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSet<M> getMessageClasses(java.util.function.Predicate<? super H> predicate)
        Obtains classes of messages which handlers satisfy the passed predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - a predicate for handler methods to filter the corresponding message classes

      • getMethods

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableCollection<H> getMethods(M messageClass,
                                                                   io.spine.type.MessageClass originClass)
        Obtains methods for handling messages of the given class and with the given origin.

        If there is no handler matching both the message and origin class, handlers will be searched by the message class only.

        Parameters:
        messageClass - the message class of the handled message
        originClass - the class of the message, from which the handled message is originate
        Returns:
        a handler method
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no method found in the map

      • getSingleMethod

        public H getSingleMethod(M messageClass,
                         io.spine.type.MessageClass originClass)
        Obtains a single handler method for messages of the given class and with the given origin.

        If there is no handler matching both the message and origin class, a handler will be searched by the message class only.

        If there is no such method or several such methods, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        messageClass - the message class of the handled message
        Returns:
        a handler method
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no such method or several such methods found in the map

      • getMethods

        public com.google.common.collect.ImmutableCollection<H> getMethods(M messageClass)
        Obtains methods for handling messages of the given class.
        Parameters:
        messageClass - the message class of the handled message
        Returns:
        handlers method
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no method found in the map

      • getSingleMethod

        public H getSingleMethod(M messageClass)
        Obtains a single handler method for messages of the given class.

        If there is no such method or several such methods, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        messageClass - the message class of the handled message
        Returns:
        a handler method
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no such method or several such methods found in the map
